The workshop was very informative and totally hands on. Danny answered all questions without hesitation and even was frank with you when he didn't know the answer.
At the end you get to take a piece of starter home with you which you can freeze or feed for further yummy breads.
I think this is a great starter workshop for everybody who is interested in getting their hands dirty for the first time.
author: Sonja S.

description: I spent a fun and inspirational afternoon learning about sour starters for doughs and making a delicious pizza from scratch.  Cat Shimizu is a skillful instructor, never boring -- in fact, she masters combining art with science in her lectures about bread making, from the microbiology of bacteria, to the aesthetics of a successful, well-aerated dough.  The pace of the class isn't rushed or erratic, and, given that it's only 2 hours long, we accomplished a lot.  Cat was very well-prepared and organized at every step of the learning process.  I even took home a whole, hand-made, professionally baked pizza for my husband.
author: Maryanne R.

description: We got a coup through guilt city and had a blast. Cat was a great teacher and now pizza will never be the same. I am now an even more judgmental prick than before when it comes to eating pizza out which is par for the course for dilettantes(you know who you are).
author: M C.

description: We found Cat's sourdough class through Groupon.  What a hidden gem.  She's enthusiastic and supportive. I also liked that the class was in the back of a cool bakery in the Mission instead of a generic cooking school.  This would be really fun to do with a group of friends or coworkers where you could buy out the whole class.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Danny did the workshop and it was inspiring. I had a Saturday job as a baker's assistant when I was a teenager growing up in the UK, hadn't seriously thought about making my own bread  since then. I'm marginally embarrassed to say that I didn't even know before yesterday what sourdough is relative to your ordinary bread. I learned more in two hours from Danny than I learned in three years just doing the tasks as instructed back in the day. Superb. Just superb. A ton of fun. One note: wear loose fitting clothing and drink plenty of water beforehand. Bakeries are hot places!!
author: Sch T.

description: I attended the Dough Development Class with a friend. The instructor, Danny, was patient and set a good tone. The class was well-paced and felt fairly comprehensive, plus the hands-on nature of it kept me totally engaged in the process. I plan to go back to learn more about making my own starter.
author: Nicole M.

description:
The bagel making class is wonderful.  Fun, informative, and I can't wait until tomorrow when I get to bake my very own bagels!

I only wish that we could have tasted some of Sour Flour's bread (or bagels), and perhaps brought home some starter along with our proto-bagels.  Those might be nice things to add to future classes.
author: Ann D.

description:
I attended the Pizza class last night it was AWESOME!!!
Our instructor Cat was very knowledgeable and truly passionate about pizza and it showed!!!
I would highly recommend this class to anyone looking to get inspired about pizza and cooking in general.
It was a small setting which worked great (6 students). We made 2 pizzas each during class ... one we ate there and one we took home. We also got dough and starter to take home.
Guess who has yummy pizza leftovers for lunch today :)
author: b B.

description:
My class with Sour Flour and Danny Gabriner far exceeded my expectations. The entire class was hands on and Danny was a wealth of knowledge and patience. He is so inspired by his company mission and his inspiration is simply contagious. 

I walked away with amazing bread and the confidence to recreate the experience in my own kitchen. I learned so much more than I paid for and I paid one third the cost compared to similar classes.

 I would recommend sour flour's classes and bread to anyone and everyone!
author: Martin H.

description:
Cat is a great teacher brimming with passion for her craft and her desire to share it with the community.

Super informative, mythbusting, simplifying master of fermentation.

She gives all takers a 5-year head start by letting students permanently adopt a wild child her 5-year old sourdough mother...

I took the starter class and will definitely be signing up for the pizza class!
author: Matt P.

description: Danny is awesome & so are his bagels!  I adore sour dough bread.  Freshly baked - how can you resist?
author: Kim S.

description: Took the Sour Flour sourdough starter class with Cat - it was awesome! Bread is surprisingly simple when Cat explains the intricacies of proper starters. Would love to take another class
author: D F.

description: Terrific Class! There was much I learned even though I've been bailing bread for years. I recommend it without any reservations.
author: Stan G.

description:
I attended the sourdough starter class and really thought it was well worth the time and $. Cat is really passionate about breadmaking and got me even more excited about getting into it. She also is a great instructor - gives lots of information, but also stresses the main points throughout the class so it really sinks in. There's also time built into the class for plenty of questions. Overall, this was one of the better "cooking" classes I've attended and would definitely recommend!

Also, you leave the class with starter so you can make your own and share it with a friend :)
author: Blair B.

description:
A friend and I bought a groupon (maybe something else) for a bagel making class at sour flour.  It was great.  I learned so much more than I thought I would at a bread making class.  Who knew that you don't use yeast to make bread?  I didn't.  The class was super fun and laid back.  The bagels I made turned out great once I baked them at home.  I just wish the class was long enough to complete the whole process, but I understand why it wasn't.

This class was a game changer, I'm dying to learn more about the craft and will definitely be taking more classes here.
author: jessica b.

description: I got my hubby the Pizza making workshop for his birthday present and we took it yesterday! All I can say is that it was EXCELLENT! Cat was super friendly and energetic and explained everything very well. The whole group was a delight to be around and we definitely learned how to make a great sourdough pizza. We got to eat almost the whole time and took home a pizza and four doughs!!! Definitely worth the money spent !
author: Susi K.

description: After baking sourdough bread at home self-taught from reading the Tartine book for over a year, I decided to take both the Sourdough Starter class as well as the Dough Development class. Both were taught by Cat - who was  great - knowledgeable, patient, nice, friendly, fun,.... - had a great time and learned some valuable tips & tricks.  (Each class ends with flatbreads or bread which is great!)    Highly recommended - fun to do with a friend.
author: Uli E.

description:
MMM... Bagel Monday!

Danny brought bagels on mondays to my work and they were seriously better than any that i have had.

I have had the opportunity to try quite a few of danny's loaves and loved each of them!
author: Gina K.

description:
I had the pleasure of meeting Danny (proprietor of said company) at the Monkey's Club's craft party. He was walking around, giving out samples of his bread, and to accompany Mmm, Butter's butter. Together they are divine. 

But here's the thing, you could eat Sour Flour all on its own. It is so soft and delicious and rivals any other sour dough that I've tasted! And it comes from a good source: a man with a vision (Danny) and a wholesome, pure form of baking.  It's all written on the Sour Flour website, "Sour Flour is mastering and expanding the art and science of bread." Ta da! 

It's as fresh as it gets! and then I put some in my fridge, put it in the toaster oven and...omg! it's just as good as day one! 

I'm excited to see Sour Flour's name in lights!
author: Christina R.

description: A group of us attended this fabulous class. Cat was an excellent instructor with passion for artisan bread. I would highly recommend the Sour Flour experience!!!
author: sherri h.

description:
My husband and I took our first ever pizza class from Cat and had a great experience! 
Our instructor Cat was very friendly and taught us the art of making delicious pizza. A big plus for us was enjoying incredible thin crust pizza and bringing home starter for another pizza feast.  We had fun and enjoyed her class and look forward to signing up for her sour dough bread making class. Thanks Cat we had a great time.
author: Florence S.

description: Detailed, hands on classes with clear instruction and great results.  Great way to jump start the learning curve to making bread.
author: Jeffery W.

description: Love it! I got a groupon voucher and God! This was one of the best groupon workshops I have ever gone. Cat Shimisu is a great and fun teacher to have.
author: Patricia F.

description: I was just amazed and definitely entertained by how much fun a bunch of people getting their hands all goey and making bread that tasted amazing could be.  Kat our teacher was amazing and just very zen about the whole process and how important it is to find your own way of bread making and just taking what you learned and making it our own...  She & Sour Flour rock!  Don't miss a chance to take a class if you love bread and want to learn about bread!! I am taking the Pizza class!!
author: Joe T.

description: The starter class is overrated.  It's apparent that the instructor is knowledgeable and earnest.  But he spent way too much time spewing forth extraneous information and failed to allot sufficient time for hands-on practice.  Also, the place seemed like it needed a good scrubbing.
author: Subrosa I.

description: Really enjoyed Cat's sourdough class last night. The class is just the right pace and a nice mix of watching and hands-on. You are in a busy commercial kitchen with lots of professional breadmaking going on around you. And the best part is that you go home with your own starter and detailed instructions for keeping it alive and then baking your own sourdough delights. Highly recommended for anyone that loves his/her carbs the way I do.
author: Michelle W.

description:
I took the Dough Development class. Danny did a great job explaining the process of Breadmaking in great detail. He incorporates a lot of "hands on" work into the class, so that everyone walks away with a good feel for how dough and starter behaves in the different stages of making bread. It was a very fun experience...there is really no exact science in how to mix everything, so everyone has a lot of freedom in trial-and-error to come up with the bread-version THEY like best, personally.

I can't wait to get to work in my own home-test-kitchen to bake some good bread.

I highly recommend the class!!!
author: Claudia D.

description: Excellent hands on class with great instructor.  She is both knowledgeable and patient in explaining every detail in how to prepare the sour dough.  We got to try to roll the dough and taste our own flat bread afterward.  I am just a hobby baker and now I feel like I know a lot about sour dough.  I am growing my starter like my pet and looking forward to take another class!
author: Phillip P.

description:
I took the sour flour class this morning and feel like I can actually make a loaf of bread by myself. Along with the sour dough starter I made in class and brought home with me. The instructor, Cat, was so enthusiastic and patient teaching all of us her secrets to preparing a delicious bread at home. 
Thank you so much.
author: Jan G.

description:
Took the Starter Workshop and found it informative and wonderful.
Mike was a great teacher, laid back, knowledgeable. 
I really got that baking bread is about intuition and feel, more so than recipes and exact numbers.

Hopefully I can keep this starter alive and pass it down to my future kids!
author: green f.

description:
Really enjoyed the Sourdough Starter Workshop and highly recommend the course to anyone interested in baking sour dough breads at home or just learning more about how this bread style is made. 
Cat was thorough with explaining culturing and maintaining the starter, and making bread. Before the course I had made several loaves that never quite turned out, and now am confident that I can bake great bread at home.
author: Steve S.

description: The bread making class with Danny was very good.  The venue was also a good place to sample all the mexican bakery specialties at the La Victoria Bakery!  They also distribute their own Sour Flour loaf at local grocery shops and I think the bread is absolutely fantastic.  Chewy and crusty and tangy, it's the perfect loaf!
author: Laura S.

description: Took the starter class last night.  Cat is great, the pace and information was right on.  I'm coming back for the pizza class!
author: Brenda M.

description: The breadmaking class we took was a lot of fun! Our instructor was very attentive and knowledgeable about bread and provided our group with a lot of great insight without going on tangents or letting anyone take over. And unlike most classes I take, I actually took something away from the experience! I guess I'm a hands-on learner.
author: Andrew B.

description: I participated in a team outing with the great folks at Sour Flour and was very pleased with the outcome! We took the dough development workshop, which was a great combination of education and execution. We also walked out with fresh baked bread, and prepared dough to bake on our own. Awesome class!
author: Tamiz A.

description:
I am currently making my third batch of bread since attending the Sour Flour dough development class, and boy, has it changed my breadmaking process!  Gone are the close following of Peter Reinhart recipes, careful purchasing and weighing of all ingredients, adjusting my day's schedule to the timeline of the recipe...Now I just whip out Danny's starter, mix with flour/water/salt to my liking, stretch+fold or knead the dough several times in the day, leave it till I'M ready to deal with it, bake it...and tasty spongy sourdough bread is ready to eat!

I can't stress enough how much Sour Flour's class has helped me get in touch with just the basics of breadmaking that dates back centuries, and Danny's generous sharing of his expertise, equipment, and time (he responds to questions on email very promptly) has truly opened doors for me.

I do advise bringing a notebook to take notes, especially if you are keen to keep doing this in the future, and ask lots of questions!  But bottom line, this class does give you enough to begin making your own bread at home, with the easiest of ingredients -- flour, water, salt, and my new "dulce" starter!
author: Sunshine W.

description: Yummy, Yummy, Yummy..... Just like bagels should taste.  In recent years bagels have lost that density and rich flavor - I found it in your bagels... Better than Boudin's Bakery (in my opinion).
author: Valerie M.

description:
Took the sourdough starter class this past weekend and really enjoyed it.  Cat was friendly, informative, patient and very encouraging.  I bake a lot of bread at home because I have to cook low sodium and commercial bread has a lot of sodium.  I also grind my own flour at home, and Cat gave me tips and advice on how to address both issues with using my starter.  

I tried to make a starter years ago and failed.  As I suspected, this class was great to learn how the starter should taste, look and feel at various stages of its cycle.  I can't learn that kind of thing from a book, I need to experience it in person.  Cat had us taste a bit of a "ready to be fed" starter and a "ready to make bread" starter and the difference was really noticeable.  We also got to see how the dough's appearance changes as it hydrates and the gluten chains link up and strengthen.  I really feel so much more confident about baking with a wild yeast starter!

I took my starter home and baked my first bread with it today.  It wasn't perfect (have to work out the proper timing) but it tasted great and looked awesome.  It is already superior to the yeast-raised breads I've been baking for the past year, no contest.
author: Suko T.

description: Great Class!!!  Took the Sour Dough class from Kat Sunday morning. Highly recommend the class for everyone. I will be back for her other classes!!
author: Mike V.

description:
I took the Dough Development Workshop through Sour Flour.  Danny was friendly, patient and knowledgeable.  I enjoyed the workshop and felt I learned a good deal on the basics of dough development.

All in all, I'd recommend it to others.
author: Justin H.

description: Six of us took a workshop with Cat, learning how to use the sourdough starter for flatbread.  Cat is an outstanding teacher -- fun, knowledgable and very encouraging. The flatbreads were delicious, and we each left there with starter to take home. Can't wait to try the sour dough pancakes!
author: Suzanne M.

description: I attended a 2 hour sourdough starter class yesterday. I had a great time and learned a ton. I feel like a learned more in that 2 hours than I had baking bread on my own on and off for the last couple years. Danny has great energy and enthusiasm for baking bread.
author: Favi F.

description:
There are lots of ways to learn these days - books, Internet, utube etc but for some things a class with humans is absolutely the best.  Bread making is a good example of that.  I took the sourdough starter class last week with Cat, and it was really great.

You get to see, smell, and taste a sourdough starter in various stages - from needs to be fed, ready to use, and just fed.  You make some bread using starter as a backdrop to learning all about the care and feeding of a  sourdough starter, and you get to eat the flatbread or take it home, as well as taking home your own starter.  My husband loved the flatbread!

This very hands on class was very energizing for me.  I had not taken a class like this in a long time, and it made me want to go back and learn more!  I drove 90 miles to take the class and it was worth it.

I am a very experienced baker and yet got a lot out of this class.  The class had students of many ages and many experience levels from novice to skilled.  Everyone learned and had a great time doing it.
author: Beth H.

description:
I've taken two classes with Sour Flour staff and both have been extremely informative, entertaining and easy.  I've been maintaining a starter for about two years.  I had no idea what to do with it, if I was keeping it well, how to bake with it.  After two classes, I've been given the know-how, and most importantly, the confidence, to bake my own bread.  Before I took these classes I had many failed experiments trying to bake.  Since I've taken the classes I have consistently turned out great loaves.  

If you want to learn how to bake bread, sign up for these classes.  The staff is friendly, happy to answer any question while at the class, happy to answer any question in the future through their hotline.  And everyone is just extremely knowledgable.
author: henry c.

description: I loved Chef Mike's Wild Yeast Starter class.  He bakes by sight and feel...and knowledge.  He knows how all of ingredients react to each other and their environment and teaches you what to look for, rather than precise recipes which there are plenty of books on already.
author: Nichole M.

description: This is a review for the Free Bagels on Monday! They are fantastic, hot, fresh, and delicious! And free. Many many thanks (I always leave a tip, I suggest you all do too!)
author: Amanda S.

description: Had a great dough workshop today with Sour Flour. Danny is very knowledgeable and paces the class well. You get to work with the dough and learn different kneading, folding and handling techniques. I learned a lot and have the bread that I made in class rising in my kitchen. I can't wait to try it. Great class!
author: Janell H.

description: I took the pizza class which was fantastic! First of all, I didn't know anything about making pizza. My instructor Cat was awesome. She was very knowledgeable and extremely friendly. There were eight of us in the class and  I learned about the entire process of making pizza which was a lot of fun and totally delicious! Our class ate awesome pizza the entire time and I went home with a pizza and a little starter which I ended up making another pizza the following night. Yummm!  Great class!
author: Paul S.

description: My girl scout troop of 5th graders took the sourdough starter class and what a great time they all had.  Cat was a great instructor and she made the class really fun for all of them.  Each girl got the attention and instruction that was needed for them to be successful in the class.  They also used science and math in a fun way and were thrilled to take home their own starter to continue the fun.  The class was a perfect addition to our San Francisco adventure weekend and well worth the money.
author: Sherry C.

description: Sour Flour shows you why the San Francisco Bay Area has become a world leader in bread baking.  I'm not saying they are the best in town, necessarily, but you will be hard pressed to find a better loaf of bread anywhere else.  Maybe I'll do a taste test.  My partner took one of their classes and thought it was great, but what I really wanted to trumpet was their bread.  I work in the area, and am able to pick up fresh loaves as often as I want - and that's pretty much every day.
author: Nick C.

description: How can you fault a place that gives away excellent whole wheat sourdough bread and partners with an established local bakery to keep the neighborhood vibrant? Such a noble way to realize their bread making mission. Have not tried the free bagels yet, but am looking forward.
author: Kmc M.

description: Danny and the whole Sour Flour crew are amazing. We took a sour-dough starter class this week and had so much fun. These guys really know their stuff, are patient, and are trying to do good for others. Our starter is growing as I type on the counter. Can't wait to make some bread and share it with friends.
author: Stephen G.

description:
We took Danny's class as part of a team building event for work and it was a blast! Both Danny and his assistant are unbelievably knowledgeable about bread. It was great to see the passion that Danny brings to the art of baking and his ability to share that with others. 

The whole experience was great. Not only did we get to make some bread and socialize, but there was a little break in the middle for us to sample some bread along with cheese and cured meats. (I don't know if this is a normal part of the package since I didn't organize the event.)

I'd highly recommend this for anyone, even if you don't think you're interested in bread at all. Danny makes it fun!
author: Vince C.

description: took bread making class with Daniel... super fun and informative and we got to enjoy the fruits of our labor at the end!  highly recommend checking this out.
author: Claire U.

description: This is a review working with sour flour from a business point of view. I started a small business around November and was working with a well known local bakery with a good product but horrible customer service and consistency. Now that I was looking to expand I no longer wanted to work with them and found sour flour through a workshop. I went out on a limb and requested custom orders which they agreed to do I was shocked lol but it turns out they are really great people and genuine of course the great customer service and consistency is a bonus. I am excited to see my business continue to grow and look forward to working with them.
author: Perla P.

description: I took the Sour Flour workshop yesterday and I cannot recommend this class more highly.  Our instructor, Cat Shimizu, took us from creating a sourdough starter through baking our own loaves of flatbread (which were delicious!).  All the while, she was entertaining, friendly, completely professional and very encouraging.  If you have any interest in learning how to bake with sourdough starter, this is the perfect class.
author: Veronica W.

description: Just took the Sour Floor sourdough starter class and it was fantastic!  Teacher is excellent, so warm, friendly, informative.  I got absolutely everything I wanted out of this class!
author: Sharon R.

description: I am a fairly focused and skilled home cook and baker.  This class was perfect for me!  I learned some very important baking ideas and frameworks from Cat, got to work with and use a starter, and left with my own baby starter which I named Frisco Kid.  Take this class.  And then take another from Cat.  She rocks!
author: I K.

description: Such a fun and great experience!  The class was perfectly geared for the allotted time and fulfilled my expectations completely.  I went in looking for the basic techniques of dough development and I absolutely left with them...and my own dough to bake at home (plus a dough scraper, rising bowl and linen!)  The instructions given by Danny were clear, concise, and my bread came out perfectly.  I highly recommend this class for anyone looking to gain a new skill in the kitchen.
author: Katie M.

description: Wow, I just took the dough development class with Danny of Sour Flour and could not have had a better experience.  Not only was the class fun and very informative, Danny answered all our questions, he is very knowledgable and he made the bread making process easy to understand.  I loved that it was completely hands on, he showed us what to do but we worked our own dough.  The class moved at a very good pace, not too fast or slow.  I think there were 8 people all together and it was great to see how all of our dough  was a little different and how to fix or correct the dough at different stages.  At the end we got to take home our proofing loaf to bake and got to taste the bread and take a cooked loaf home.  I would love to take more classes from Danny.   He encouraged us to email or call with our bread making questions, how great it that??? I wouldnt hesitate to take the class and hope to take the other classes soon.
author: Terri V.

description: We took the sourdough pizza dough class. Cat is a really great teacher and you get to make and eat tons of pizza. Worth the time to take the class, even for non-chefs
author: jason e.

description: This was not just a class...it was an experience!  I  enjoyed not only learning the facts about bread, but the hands on experience gave me the motivation  and courage to actually try what I had learned at home.  Apparently, people who are interested in baking are just really nice if our class is the norm.  It was so much fun and I appreciated  Cat, our master baker's, patience and fun-loving spiirit!  This experience is one you do not want to miss!
author: Shirley W.

description:
I grabbed a Living Social for the dough development class a few weeks ago.  I appreciate that they added classes after the coupon when all the classes sold out for  April.

Small classes, knowledgeable instructor, casual environment, and supporting an interesting non-profit are all good things in my book.  I now know more about why my homemade loaves were not very good.  I'm not sure I'm quite ready to take all my lessons into making lots of bread all the time, but at least now I know where to buy some and who to ask for help.
author: Lily C.

description: We (mom, dad, and 13-year-old son--it was Father's Day) took a pizza-making class at Sour Flour, and it was wonderful.  We learned about sourdough starter, making the dough, kneading and growing the dough, and building and baking pizza.  Along the way our instructor, Cat Shimizu, shared fascinating information about the microbiology of rising dough, the cultural geography of sourdough, and lots of useful baking tips.  All this while we were making and eating delicious pizza, and we had extra pies to take home, along with our sourdough and starter.  Even our teenager remarked what a fun time he had!
author: Michael P.

description: You have to take Cat's Sour Dough Bagel Workshop! We used sourdough starter, made our own dough, "rolled our own" bagels out, dropped them in the boiling water, and baked them. We even got to taste the fermented sour dough starter at various stages of 'readiness' so we'd understand the process. And then .... we ate our warm bagels with yummy jam, cream cheese and butter. Our teacher, Cat, was awesome and did a great job providing everything we needed and was so knowledgeable. Can't wait to take the starter class with her!
author: Martha A.

description:
Wow. Danny just led a one-on-one bread baking class in my house and I learned more this afternoon than I have from my stack of books and list of blogs (not that those aren't great to have too). There's just nothing like having an enthusiastic, fun person who loves baking bread, teach you in your own baking space. He suggested ways to improve my home baking, showed me key techniques for shaping, proofing, and **totally key** how to understand and take charge of bread recipes by breaking them down into a few simple factors. These areas are ones I've read a lot about, but it's much easier to learn in person from someone showing you how.

I've taken a bunch of food/cooking classes, and would recommend this  for someone at almost any level who wants to learn more, and for a great gift.
author: Jennifer E.

description: I took two classes back in October 2011 and I would highly recommend both.  The original class was dealing with starter which I continue to make bread from to this day.  I love the fact that I continuing to learn and by all means, practice makes perfect so you must keep trying.  The second class I took was more focused on shaping and baking which helped me get better in my bread baking endeavor.  Not all loafs turn out perfect because a lot of things effect the outcome like the temperature of your house but I continue to keep trying and for the pennies spent on flour, water and salt it has been well worth the price of the classes.  I did however get a deal on the class so check all those coupon sites and see if you too can find a half priced deal.  My hope going forward is that they begin offering more classes, for example how to bake different kinds of bread.  My favorite part of the class is that it is hands on.  Being a visual person I find it much better doing it than reading about it.  By the way the instructors/bakers like Danny were great and have answered questions via email even after the class was long over.
author: Dianne M.

description: Their bread is delicious.  It is a wheat-based sourdough, which gives it a little added flavor in my opinion.  Plus, what can't you love about a company who has free giveaways built into the business plan!?!?!
author: Yogini R.

description: Big fan of Sour Flour. The intro bread class was informative, fun, and best of all I have kept my starter alive for months! The instructors stuck around to answer additional questions and were enthusiastic and knew a ton about the subject.
author: Angela M.

description: I signed for the begginer bread class through Homerun.  The class size was small (5 people) which made it more fun and interactive.  Danny knows his stuff, the instructions were clear, engaging and to the point.  He pretty much covered all the basics in a few hours and gudied all of us for a hands-on feeding session.  Highly reccomended to anyone who wants to learn more about fermentation and making real bread!
author: ebru t.

description:
my partner and i had the privilege of being invited to a pizza making party that danny lead.  what a fun event!!!  the dough education was easy to pick up on with danny's teaching style.  of course the pizza that we made was FABULOUS!!!  

what a wonderful (and tasty) experience all around.

adrina phipps
redwood city, ca
author: adrina p.

description: I had such a great time at the Sourdough Starter class, I took the Bagel class as well as the Sour Flour Artisan Bread 2 Workshop. Both classes were just as wonderful as the 1st class. These classes provides you with hands on experiences, samples to munch on, my own bagels made in class so I can take home to finish, and a loaf of artisan bread I made in the other class also to take home to finish. My expectations was to grasp and understand the bread making process using the starter I fed loaded with wild yeast. What else can I say other than I'm glad all the classes I've attended so far was attended by a great group of people and of course our fantastic Instructor, Cat. Its been such a positive experience that I want to take the Pizza class next. I recommend these classes for those who want to experience the world of bread making. Please note that these classes are 2 hours each and the time flies by so fast.
author: Mailene T.

description: little content in the class, given the time and cost
author: Andre S.
